The resource of the instance.

Specifies whether to automatically complete the payment. Valid values:

1.  **true**: automatically completes the payment. You must make sure that your account balance is sufficient.
2.  **false**: does not automatically complete the payment. An unpaid order is generated.

>  The default value is true. If your account balance is insufficient, you can set the AutoPay parameter to false to generate an unpaid order. Then, you can log on to the ApsaraDB RDS console to complete the payment.
The coupon code.

The major engine version of the destination instance. The value of this parameter varies based on the value of **Engine**.

*   Valid values when Engine is set to MySQL: **5.5, 5.6, 5.7, and 8.0**
*   Valid values when Engine is set to SQLServer: **2008r2, 08r2\_ent_ha, 2012, 2012\_ent_ha, 2012\_std_ha, 2012\_web, 2014\_std_ha, 2016\_ent_ha, 2016\_std_ha, 2016\_web, 2017\_std_ha, 2017\_ent, 2019\_std_ha, and 2019\_ent**
*   Valid values when Engine is set to PostgreSQL: **10.0, 11.0, 12.0, 13.0, 14.0, and 15.0**

The type of the database node. Valid value:

*   **Master**: the primary node
*   **Slave**: the secondary node
The additional business information about the instance.

DescribeTasks.summary: You can call the DescribeTasks operation to query the tasks that are running on an instance.

schema.description: The ID of the instance.
The beginning of the time range to query. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm*Z format. The time must be in UTC.
The end of the time range to query. The end time must be later than the start time. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm*Z format. The time must be in UTC.
The number of entries to return per page. Valid values: **30 to 100**. Default value: **30**.
The page number. Pages start from page 1. Default value: **1**.
The status of the task. This parameter is invalid.
The operation that is used by the task.

TaskProgressInfo.description: The details of the task execution.

BeginTime.description: The start time of the task. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC .

DBName.description: The name of the database. If the task involves a database, the database name is returned.

ExpectedFinishTime.description:
The estimated end time of the task.

> In most cases, this parameter is empty.

FinishTime.description: The end time of the task. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC.

Progress.description: The progress of the task in percentage.

ProgressInfo.description:
The description of the task progress.

> If no progress description is provided for the task, this parameter is empty.

Remain.description:
The estimated remaining time of the task. Unit: seconds.

>  If the task is not running, this parameter is not returned or the returned value is **0**.

Status.description: The status of the task.

StepProgressInfo.description: The progress of the subtask. For example, a value of `1/4` indicates that the task consists of four subtasks and the first subtask is in progress.

TaskAction.description: The operation that is used by the task, such as **CreateDBInstance**.

TaskErrorCode.description:
The error code that is returned when an error occurs.

> This parameter is returned only when an error occurs.

TaskErrorMessage.description:
The error message that is returned when an error occurs.

>  This parameter is returned only when an error occurs.

PageNumber.description: The page number of the returned page.

PageRecordCount.description: The number of entries on the current page.

TotalRecordCount.description: The total number of returned entries.

DescribeTasks.title: DescribeTasks

schema.description: The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.
The ID of the proxy mode.

The database engine of the instance. Valid values:

*   MySQL
*   SQLServer
*   PostgreSQL
*   PPAS
*   MariaDB

By default, this operation queries the instances that run any of the supported database engine types.
The zone ID of the instance.
The status of the instance. For more information, see [Instance state table](~~26315~~).

Specifies whether the instance expires. Valid values:

*   **True**: queries the instances that have expired.
*   **False**: does not query instances that have expired.
The keyword that is used for the search. The keyword can be part of an instance ID or an instance description.
The ID of the instance.

The role of the instance that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Primary**: primary instance
*   **Readonly**: read-only instance
*   **Guard**: disaster recovery instance
*   **Temp**: temporary instance

By default, this operation queries the instances of all roles.
The region ID of the instance.

The number of entries to return on each page. Valid values: **1 to 100**.

Default value: **30**.
The number of the page to return.

The network type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Classic**
*   **VPC**
The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC).
The ID of the vSwitch.
The instance type of the instance. For more information, see [Instance types](~~26312~~).
The version of the database engine.

The type of the database node. Valid values:

*   **Master**: the primary node
*   **Slave**: the secondary node

The billing method of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Postpaid**: pay-as-you-go
*   **Prepaid**: subscription

By default, this operation queries the instances that use any of the supported billing methods.

The connection mode of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Standard**: standard mode
*   **Safe**: database proxy mode

By default, this operation queries the instances that use any of the supported connection modes.
The ID of the current instance.
The ID of the resource group.
The response parameters.

DBInstance.description: An array that consists of the details about the instances.

Category.description:
The RDS edition of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Basic**: RDS Basic Edition
*   **HighAvailability**: RDS High-availability Edition
*   **Finance**: RDS Enterprise Edition

ConnectionMode.description:
The connection mode of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Standard**: standard mode
*   **Safe**: database proxy mode

CreateTime.description: The time when the instance was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC.

DBInstanceClass.description: The instance type of the instance. For more information, see [Instance types](~~26312~~).

DBInstanceDescription.description:
The name of the instance. It must be 2 to 256 characters in length. The value can contain letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-). The value must start with a letter.

> The value cannot start with http:// or https://.

DBInstanceNetType.description:
The network connection type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Internet**
*   **Intranet**

DBInstanceStatus.description: The status of the instance. For more information, see [Instance state table](~~26315~~).

DBInstanceStorageType.description:
The storage type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **local_ssd/ephemeral_ssd**: local SSD
*   **cloud_ssd**: standard SSD.
*   **cloud_essd**: enhanced SSD (ESSD)

DBInstanceType.description:
The role of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Primary**: primary instance
*   **Readonly**: read-only instance
*   **Guard**: disaster recovery instance
*   **Temp**: temporary instance

DestroyTime.description: The time when the instance was destroyed. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC.

Engine.description:
The database engine of the instance. Valid values:

*   MySQL
*   SQLServer
*   PostgreSQL
*   PPAS
*   MariaDB

EngineVersion.description: The version of the database engine.

ExpireTime.description: The time when the instance expired. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC.

GuardDBInstanceId.description: The ID of the disaster recovery instance. This parameter is returned only when the instance is a primary instance and has a disaster recovery instance.

InsId.description: The ID of the instance role.

InstanceNetworkType.description:
The network type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Classic**
*   **VPC**

LockMode.description:
The lock method of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Unlock**: The instance is not locked.
*   **ManualLock**: The instance is manually locked.
*   **LockByExpiration**: The instance is automatically locked after it expires.
*   **LockByRestoration**: The instance is automatically locked before a rollback.
*   **LockByDiskQuota**: The instance is automatically locked because its storage capacity is exhausted and the instance is inaccessible.

LockReason.description: The reason why the instance was locked.

MasterInstanceId.description: The ID of the primary instance. If the value of this parameter is null, the instance is a primary instance.

MutriORsignle.description:
Indicates whether multi-region deployment is used. Valid values:

*   **true**: Multi-region deployment is used.
*   **false**: Multi-region deployment is not used.

PayType.description:
The billing method of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Postpaid**: pay-as-you-go
*   **Prepaid**: subscription

ReadOnlyDBInstanceId.description: An array consisting of the IDs of the read-only instances that are attached to the primary instance.

DBInstanceId.description: The ID of the read-only instance.

RegionId.description: The region ID of the instance.

ResourceGroupId.description: The ID of the resource group.

TempDBInstanceId.description: The ID of the temporary instance.

VpcCloudInstanceId.description: The ID of the instance in the VPC.

VpcId.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC).

ZoneId.description: The zone ID of the instance.

PageNumber.description: The page number of the returned page.

PageRecordCount.description: The number of entries returned on the current page.

TotalRecordCount.description: The total number of entries returned.

schema.description: The region ID. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query the most recent region list.
The instance ID. You can call the DescribeDBInstances operation to query the IDs of instances.
The ID of the resource group.
A deprecated parameter. You do not need to configure this parameter.
A deprecated parameter. You do not need to configure this parameter.
The response parameters.

DBInstanceAttribute.description: An array that consists of the fields in **DBInstanceAttribute**.

items.description: The following table describes the fields.

AvailabilityValue.description: The service availability of the instance in percentage.

ConnectionMode.description:
The connection mode of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Performance**: standard mode.
*   **Safety**: enhanced mode

DBInstanceClass.description: The instance type of the instance.

DBInstanceMemory.description: The memory capacity of the instance. Unit: MB.

DBInstanceNetType.description:
The network type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Internet**
*   **Intranet**

DBInstanceStorage.description: The storage capacity of the instance. Unit: GB.

DBInstanceType.description:
The instance type. Valid values:

*   **Primary**: primary instance
*   **ReadOnly**: read-only instance
*   **Guard**: disaster recovery instance
*   **Temp**: temporary instance

DBMaxQuantity.description: The maximum number of databases that can be created on the instance.

Engine.description: The database engine of the instance.

ExportKey.description: A deprecated parameter. You do not need to specify this parameter.

GuardDBInstanceId.description: The ID of the disaster recovery instance that is attached to the primary instance.

IncrementSourceDBInstanceId.description: The ID of the instance from which incremental data comes. The incremental data of a disaster recovery instance comes from its primary instance. The incremental data of a read-only instance comes from its primary instance. If this parameter is not returned, the instance is a primary instance.

LockMode.description: The lock mode of the instance.

LockReason.description: The reason why the instance was locked.

MaintainTime.description: The maintenance window of the instance. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard and is displayed in UTC. In the ApsaraDB RDS console, the maintenance window is displayed in UTC+8.

MaxConnections.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections.

MaxIOPS.description: The maximum number of I/O requests per second.

PayType.description: The billing method of the instance.

Port.description: The port that is used to connect to the instance over an internal network.

ReadDelayTime.description: The latency of data replication from the primary instance to the read-only instance. This parameter is valid for read-only instances.

SecurityIPList.description: The IP addresses in the whitelist.

slaveRegion.description: A deprecated parameter. You do not need to specify this parameter.

items.description: A deprecated parameter. You do not need to specify this parameter.

TempDBInstanceId.description: The ID of the temporary instance that is attached to the primary instance.
